fix conventional commit.description: Fixes a bug in the codebase

feat conventional commit.description: Adds a new feature to the codebase

chore conventional commit.description: Changes to the build process or auxiliary tools and libraries such as documentation generation

style conventional commit.description: A style change that does not affect the meaning of the code (white-space, formatting, missing semi-colons, etc)

refactor conventional commit.description: A code change that neither fixes a bug nor adds a feature

perf conventional commit.description: A code change that improves performance

test conventional commit.description: Adding missing tests or correcting existing tests

build conventional commit.description: Changes that affect the build system or external dependencies (example scopes: gulp, broccoli, npm)

ci conventional commit.description: Changes to our CI configuration files and scripts (example scopes: Travis, Circle, BrowserStack, SauceLabs)

breaking change conventional commit.description: A commit that has breaking changes
